verses.text: O God of \add my\add* fathers, and Lord of mercy, who hast made all \add things\add* with thy word,
and ordained man through thy wisdom, that he should have dominion over the creatures which thou hast made,
and order the world according to equity and righteousness, and execute judgment with an upright heart:
give me wisdom, that sitteth by thy throne; and reject me not from among thy children:
for I thy servant and son of thine handmaid \add am\add* a feeble person, and of a short time, and too young for the understanding of judgment and laws.
For though a man be \add never so\add* perfect among the children of men, yet if thy wisdom be not \add with him\add*, he shall be nothing regarded.
Thou hast chosen me \add to be\add* a king of thy people, and a judge of thy sons and daughters:

thou hast commanded \add me\add* to build a temple upon thy holy mount, and an altar in the city wherein thou dwellest, a resemblance of the holy tabernacle, which thou hast prepared from the beginning.
And wisdom \add was\add* with thee: which knoweth thy works, and was present when thou madest the world, and knew what \add was\add* acceptable in thy sight, and right in thy commandments.
O send her out of \add thy\add* holy heavens, and from the throne of thy glory, that being present she may labour with me, that I may know what is pleasing unto thee.
For she knoweth and understandeth all \add things\add*, and she shall lead me soberly in my doings, and preserve me in her power.
So shall my works be acceptable, and \add then\add* shall I judge thy people righteously, and be worthy to sit in my fatherâ€™s seat.
For what man \add is he that\add* can know the counsel of God? or who can think what the will of the Lord is?
For the thoughts of mortal \add men are\add* miserable, and our devices \add are but\add* uncertain.
For the corruptible body presseth down the soul, and the earthy tabernacle weigheth down the mind that museth upon many things.

And hardly do we guess \add aright\add* at \add things\add* that are upon earth, and with labour do we find the \add things\add* that are before us: but the \add things\add* that are in heaven who hath searched out?
And thy counsel who hath known, except thou give wisdom, and send thy Holy Spirit from above?
For so the ways of them which \add lived\add* on the earth were reformed, and men were taught the \add things that are\add* pleasing unto thee, and were saved through wisdom.
